meanings.definition: Able to be understood or comprehended.
meanings.sent1: The teacher's explanation was so intelligible that even the youngest students could follow along.
meanings.sent2: The instructions on the package were clear and intelligible, making it easy to assemble the furniture.
meanings.sent3: The cat's meows were surprisingly intelligible, almost as if it was trying to have a conversation.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions were like an intelligible map, each expression revealing a different part of her inner world.
meanings.sent5: The melody of the song was so intelligible that it stayed in my mind long after it ended.

meanings.definition: Capable of being understood or perceived clearly.
meanings.sent1: The handwriting on the note was barely intelligible, making it hard to decipher the message.
meanings.sent2: The speaker's voice was loud and intelligible, reaching every corner of the room.
meanings.sent3: The toddler's attempt at singing was adorable but not very intelligible to the ears.
meanings.sent4: The artist's abstract painting was like an intelligible puzzle, each stroke adding to the overall picture.
meanings.sent5: The concept became more intelligible to me after the teacher used simple examples to explain it.
